Description: Limestone ostracon: containing a religious exercise, with remains of ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink on one side and a further eight lines of Greek text on the other side. Ps 80:4 and 117:19-20.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.21, Pl.16)
von Lemm 1908 / Koptische Miscellen LI-LXI (p.1332-34, no.4)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (62269) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/62269)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 16.1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
